question: 覆る
userAnswer: to: topple-over/capsize | be: overturned/toppled overruled/reversed | discredited
activeAnswer: to: topple-over/capsize | be: overturned/toppled overruled/reversed | discredited
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>capsize</kanji> but the verb version is what happens when a plan or idea capsizes. It going <vocabulary>to be overturned</vocabulary>. It was a bad idea, go back, don't do it or we'll all sink!
sourceReadingMnemonic: Of all the ideas that need <vocabulary>to be overturned</vocabulary>, it's the ones from the <reading><ja>靴</ja> guy</reading> (<ja>くつがえ</ja>). He thinks we should only wear shoes. Not shoes and nothing else, but shoes all over out entire bodies. Yikes, now that's an idea I'd like <vocabulary>to be retracted</vocabulary>, <ja>靴</ja> guy.
